Sentencas: The main aim of the paper is to propose hierarchical modeling as a suitable methodology to perform control-oriented analysis of planar solid oxide fuel cells (P-SOFC).
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At the high level of the hierarchical structure is a one-dimensional, steady-state model, developed referring to the state of the art in the field of SOFC modeling.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Validation is conducted via comparison with both experimental tests and standard references derived from literature.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the proposed modeling structure, at the low-level is the control-oriented model, developed on the basis of the information provided by the higher level model and assuming the SOFC behaves as a first-order system.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The thermal dynamics is considered dominant with respect to both electrochemistry and mass transfer dynamics.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, SOFC transients are modeled applying the conservation of energy principle (heat balance) to a lumped control volume, including interconnect, electrolyte and electrodes.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Due to the lack of suitable experimental data, model accuracy is verified by comparing the simulated fuel cell response to similar data available in literature, generated by means of a physical comprehensive model.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Extensive simulations of the fuel cell dynamic behavior are performed to analyze in detail the SOFC dynamics with respect to load changes.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, an application example is given, dealing with the development of a PI controller to limit temperature rise across the cell within a safe range.
Titulo: A hierarchical modeling approach to the simulation and control of planar solid oxide fuel cells
